intro: Erigeron emodi, commonly known as the Himalayan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing white to pale blue ray florets. Erigeron emodi is known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
